title: Admin || Requests - Display Number of Conflicts in Request Tables
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to see the number of Country conflicts a request has at a glance, so that I can identify any geographical constraints to a request easily.

1. The number of *requested* conflicting broadcasts found is displayed in the *Conflicts* column of the Requests Table.
a. Displays everywhere a Request table is displayed.
b. NOTE: This column only exists in the Request Approver view.

2. Backup request *Conflicts* column populates with the above logic, but for the Backup game request.

title: Admin || Requests - Update "All Open Requests" to "All Requests"
custom_steps:
As an Admin/Request Approver/Engineering Approver, I want to see all requests in one place, not just the open ones. 

1. Clicking/Tapping on *All Requests* displays requests of all statuses: _Pending, Engineering, Finalized, Denied,_ and _Cancelled._
2. *All Open Requests* does not display on the Requests page for Admins, Request Approvers, and Engineering Approvers.

title: Broadcaster || Game Request Drawer - Surface Warning if Broadcaster Submits More Requests than They're Allotted
custom_steps:
As an Request Approver, I want to notify Broadcasters that they've submitted a game that violates their contract, so that they begin getting familiar with the constraints of their contracts.

_Zeplin:_ https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/675c8d7570208e2b6309e1b7  (option 2)

1. Warning module surfaces if any violation is detected in the Applicable Rules check.

a. General Restrictions violations display in pop up.

 * AC of https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2229 are met.
 * Pending and approved game request counts display in the line item.

b. Regular Season Days of the Week Restrictions violations display in pop up.

  * AC of https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2230 are met.

c. Possible Conflict, Jewel Event, Special Notes, and Restricted Broadcaster information are not displayed on the pop up.

2. Warning message on pop up reads "This request potentially conflicts with contract terms"

3. Clicking/tapping *Submit* submits the game request.
a. NOTE: A broadcaster can submit any game request past what they're allotted in the respective fields of their Client Broadcaster Profile.

4. Clicking/tapping the *X* closes the window and brings the requesting broadcaster back to the game request drawer.

5. Clicking/tapping *Cancel* cancels the game request, deleting any information previously inputted in the workflow.

6. No *Explanation* field displays.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Allow Users with Same Client Mapping to See All Requests of Parent Broadcast
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to see all requests placed by my parent Broadcast, so that I don't place requests for the same games my colleagues have.

1. Users with the same Client Mapping will see all requests, including status, in their.
a. Request Table.
b. Schedule Calendar.
c. Schedule Summary Table.

2. EX) Sammy & Mckervin both work for DanTV. When Sammy places a request for a Red Sox game, Mckervin sees it in his request table, schedule, and schedule summary table, too.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Backup Request Must Be on Same Day as Primary Request
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to limit Backup Requests to the same day as Primary requests, so that requesting broadcasters can have same-day backup plans.

1. Broadcasters can only request backup games with the same *Date* as their primary game request.
2. *Backup* field is limited to games on the same *Date* as the game of the primary request in the Game Request Drawer.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Calendar and Request Table Functionality
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to be able to see details about my game requests, so that I can ensure all inputted details are correct.

Zeplin
Click from Schedule Section Functionality: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee 

Drawer Examples: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9 


1. Implement Game Request Drawer wireframes.

2. Clicking/tapping on a request in the _Event_/_Backup_ columns of the summary table opens a summary drawer of the game request.

3. Clicking/tapping on a game in the Calendar
a. Opens a game request drawer if the game has not been already requested.
b. Opens a game request summary drawer if the game was previously requested.

4. Details displayed on the game request drawer match the most up-to-date details of the game request selected.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Implement Desktop Game Selection Functionality
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to be able to request games, so that I can get approval for broadcasting them. 

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee  


1. Game request drawer layout is implemented https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2185  

2. When user clicks/taps submit on a game request drawer:
a. Game request appears in request table.
b. Applicable Rules check is run.
c. Possible Conflict check is run.
d. Status of game request is automatically _Pending_.
 * Game request status follows logic outlined in https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2177

3. Clicking/tapping *Submit* submits the game request.

4. Clicking/tapping *Cancel* cancels the game request.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Implement Possible Conflicts Rule Check
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to implement the Possible Conflicts check when a game is requested, so that I can identify any conflicts within a broadcast region.

Zeplins: 

Request table: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66d9f4f63158fab7123365c9

Countries in Broadcaster Profile: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960 


1. Possible Conflicts check runs upon submission of any game request.

2. Possible Conflicts check only runs on *Countries* field of _Contract_ section of requesting broadcaster's profile.
a. Checks whether another broadcaster has requested the same game in the same *Countries*.

3. Date of game must fall within years of Contract constraints for Countries conflict to exist.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Implement Restricted Networks Logic
custom_steps:
1. If a Restricted Network is assigned to a game:
* The Network is hidden in the Preferred Networks dropdown from all Client Broadcasters who do not have the Network present in their Network Rights field.
* The Network displays in the Preferred Networks dropdown for all Client Broadcasters who have the Network present in their Network Rights field.

NOTE: Restricted Network is defined as a Network that has the Restricted field checked in their profile.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Request Drawer Layout
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to be able to request games, so that I can get approval for broadcasting them. 

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee  

1. Implement Desktop and mobile wireframes.
a. NOTE: Drawer is the same across Desktop and Mobile.

2. When broadcaster clicks/taps game module in schedule section, game request drawer opens.

3. Broadcaster can click/tap *Preferred Network* drop down.
a. Required to click/tap *Submit*.

4. Broadcaster can click/tap *Taken For* field.
a. Required to click/tap *Submit*.

5. Broadcaster can click/tap *Backup* drop down.
a. Drop down options are games shown in Schedule Calendar to the left.
b. Drop down does not include selected game.
c. Not required for submit.

6. *Notes* field is a freeform text field. 
a. Not required for submit.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Requests Section Layout
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to view my game requests and their statuses in BATTER, so that I can stay up to date with the games I've been approved to broadcast.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee
MLB Info Screen:https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67068683db88fc40b3e7a312


1. Implement Desktop wireframe.

2. Requests Table added.
a. Columns show as:
 * Requestor
 * Day
 * Event 
 * Requested
 * Status
 * Backup
 * Backup Status

 b. Requests Table left rail displays:
  * Filters with counts displayed for:
 
     * Pending
     * Approved
     * Finalized
     * Cancelled
     * Denied
     * All Requests

  c. Request Table top rail displays filters for:
    * *Season* filter
    * *Team* filter
    * Search bar.

3. Request drawer layout is implemented https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2185.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Requests Table Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Broadcaster, I want to request and view the statuses of my game requests, so that I can easily track which games I'm permitted to broadcast.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee


1. Implement Desktop wireframes.

2. Filters display information in the Requests table that match the selected values.
a. *Team* dropdown defaults *All Teams*.
 * Drop down displays teams existing in the Event and Backup columns.
 * Counts displayed in left rail filters updated to match filtered table results.
 * User can select multiple teams to filter by.

 b.  *Year* dropdown defaults to the current year. 
 * Other filter values are years in the format YYYY.
 * Counts displayed in left rail filters update to match filtered table results.

 c. Left Rail defaults *Pending*.
 * Clicking/tapping on Approved, Finalized, Cancelled, Denied, and All Requests filters the table by the chosen value.
 * Counts displayed in left rail filters do not update to match filtered table results when *left rail filter* is clicked/tapped.

 d. *Search* defaults empty.
 * Accepts freeform text.
 * Surfaces line items with matching keywords.
 * Does not reset any top or left rail filter that has a non-default value selected.
 * Results match line items in *Day*, *Requested*, *Event*, and *Backup* columns.

 e. Clicking/tapping a column header sorts the table by that column.
 * Clicking/tapping the column again will sort the Requests table the opposite way.
 * Defaults Ascending.

3. Table has vertical scroll.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Requests Table Population
custom_steps:
As a Broadcaster, I want accurate, real-time information on my game requests, so that I can easily see which games I have been approved to broadcast.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee


1. Implement Desktop mockups.

2. Requests table is updated in real-time with newly inputted requests.
a. Counts of left rail filters will update to reflect this request.

3. *Day* displays the Event's 3-letter abbreviated day.

4. *Event* column displays primary game request's Day/Time and Teams information.

5. *Requested* displays the day/time in format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm in ET.

6. *Status* column displays status of Event game request.
a. Displayed status matches phase of approval process Primary game request falls in.
b. Colors of status match the following:
 *  _Pending:_ orange
 * _Engineering:_ yellow
 * _Finalized:_ green
 * _Denied:_ red

7. *Backup* column displays Backup game request's Day/Time and Teams information.
a. Data only populates if Backup game has been requested.

8. *Backup Status* column displays status of Backup game request.
a. Data only populates if Backup game has been requested.
b. Displayed Backup status matches phase of approval process game request falls in.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Schedule Section Filter/Sort Functionality
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to request and track the status of requested games in BATTER, so that I can broadcast games I've been approved for.

Zeplin Link: 

Broadcaster Landing Page: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee
MLB Info Screen: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67068683db88fc40b3e7a312


1. Schedule section added.

2. Clicking/tapping *All MLB Info* hyperlinks to the help/Contact Us page.

3. Clicking/tapping *Select Single Day* shows games in the Calendar view for only the day selected.

4. Clicking/tapping *Year* dropdown displays previous years.
a. Format YYYY.
b. Defaults to current year.
c. Data dynamically adapts to chosen year within the Schedule section.

5. Clicking/Tapping the {{Date}} selector opens a calendar flyout.
a. Format mm/dd/yy.
b. Accepts only numbers.
c. Clicking the left/right arrows changes the 7-day period as intended.
 * Right: Forward in time
 * Left: Backward in time
 * If no games appear in any given week, grey out the directional arrow that would bring you to that week.

6. *Team* filter defaults *All Teams*.
a. Dropdown displays team names. 
b. If a team is selected, but there are no games involving the chosen team, display a message saying -The selected team has no games for the chosen week-  "No requests for the given filters".
c. Dropdown is multi-select.
 * If multiple teams are chosen, surface the union of both team's games, not just the intersection.

7. *Display Backups in Calendar* toggle defaults *On*.
a. Switching on/off displays/hides the Backup game requests from the calendar view.
b. If *Display Backups in Calendar* is switched off, the calendar size stays the same.
c. -If switched off, Backups would not appear in the Calendar summary table.-

8. Clicking/tapping a column header in the Calendar summary table sorts the table by that column.
a. Clicking/tapping the column again will sort the Calendar table the opposite way.
b. Defaults Ascending.

9. Calendar has vertical scroll.

10. Summary table has vertical scroll.

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Schedule Section Layout
custom_steps:
As a broadcaster, I want to request and view my game request statuses in BATTER, so that I can stay up to date with the games I've been approved to broadcast.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee

title: Broadcaster || Requests - Schedule Section Population
custom_steps:
As a Broadcaster, I want accurate, real-time information on my game requests, so that I can easily maintain a schedule of games I've been approved to broadcast.
Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66df3175ceed3d000862bcee


1. Implement Desktop wireframes.

2. Games displayed in calendar:
a. Format ORG @ ORG with hh:mm AM/PM game time in ET.
b. Must fall within the selected date range.
c. Bolded "B" distinguishes Backup games from Primary games.
d. Colors of game request status match the following:
 * _Pending:_ orange
 * _Engineering:_ yellow
 * _Finalized:_ green
 * _Denied:_ red
 * Any unselected game is gray with black lettering.
 * Any game that a broadcaster can not select is gray with light gray lettering.

3. Games uploaded to IGSP via same logic as BATTER.

4. Summary table only displays information on the games that are requested and appear in the calendar view.
a. Summary table has same requirements as [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2119] .

title: Client Broadcaster || Requests - Build "Cancel" Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Client Broadcaster, I want to be able to cancel a request, so that any extraneous requests can be cleaned up.


1. Only fully submitted game requests can be cancelled.
a. EX) Game request must display in one of the Request tables to be able to be cancelled.

2. Clicking/tapping *Cancel* in a Game Request Summary drawer:
a. Opens a modal that asks the CB if they're sure they want to cancel.
 * Clicking/tapping *Yes*:
       *  Closes both the modal and the Game Request Summary drawer.
       *  Removes the request from all Request tables. 
 * Clicking/tapping *No* loses the modal, bringing the CB back to the Game Request Summary drawer

3. Cancelled requests are only displayed in:
a. The *All Requests* filtered view of the Requests table.
b. The *Cancelled* filtered view of the Requests table.

4. Game requests can be cancelled across all statuses.

title: Client Broadcaster || Requests - Mobile Filter Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Client Broadcaster, I want to filter on the Requests table, so that I can find game requests more easily.

1. Search Bar displays at top of page.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.

2. *Status* dropdown displays beneath the search bar.

3. Date picker displays beneath the *Status* filter.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.
4. *Teams* dropdown displays beneath date picker.

5. *Select Custom Dates* button displays in line with the requests count, beneath the *Teams* dropdown.
a. Clicking/tapping opens a calendar.
b. Selecting a date range in the calendar flyout filters the requests table for requests that fall within that date range (inclusive).

6. Filter behavior is the same as desktop for all filters.

title: IGSP Requesters can't cancel their own requests
custom_steps:
ISSUE
As [batter_igsp_requester1@mlb.com|mailto:batter_igsp_requester1@mlb.com] or [batter_igsp_requester2@mlb.com|mailto:batter_igsp_requester2@mlb.com], I am unable to cancel the requests that they made.  Clicking on the *Cancel Request* button in the drawer doesn't seem to do anything.  No errors in the console.


Steps:
Test that Requests have the ability to cancel their own request, or requests made on their behalf.
1. As a broadcaster create three requests.  (Single game request & 2 games with a backups.)
2. As Admin, create the same on behalf of broadcaster.
3. As Requester, attempt to cancel the requests, then the backup, in different orders.
4. If the Requester user is able to cancel the requests, then this is working as expected.

title: Broadcaster || Game Request Drawer - Make "Broadcaster" a Dropdown in GRD if User has Multiple Client Mappings
custom_steps:
As a Rights Holder with multiple client mappings, I want to choose which broadcaster to place requests for.

1. If user has multiple client mappings, clicking/tapping a game tile surfaces a drawer with a dropdown where the Broadcaster name is.

     a. Broadcaster is a single select dropdown.

     b. Defaults alphabetically.

     c. Modal has blue Continue button in bottom left hand corner.

     d. Modal has white Cancel button in bottom right hand corner.

     e. Dropdown values are the exact client mappings that user has.

2. Clicking/tapping a broadcaster in the dropdown changes the potential violations according to selection

3. game request drawer…

    a. The game request is being made for the selected broadcaster.

    b. Selected Broadcaster displays in the white header bar.

    c. Clicking/tapping Submit on the game request drawer places the request on behalf of the selected broadcaster.

4. If user is a viewer for a Client Broadcaster, this broadcaster does not display in the dropdown.

    a. NOTE: they can’t place requests for Broadcasters they’re only viewers for.

5. Modal reads “Which Broadcaster are you placing a request for?”.

title: Broadcaster || Game Request Drawer - Display "Backup Transmit Destination" Field When Backup Game is Selected
custom_steps:
As a Rights Holder, I want to select a transmit destination for my backup game, so that I know what routes to take.

1. Selecting a backup game displays Backup Transmit Destination dropdown.

2. Field is required.

3. Dropdown is single select.

4. Values in dropdown are values from the Transmit Destinations setting page.

5. Selecting a value from the dropdown…
     a. Closes the dropdown.

     b. Assigns that value to the field in the backend.

title: Broadcaster || Game Request Drawer - Require "Transmit Destination"
custom_steps:
The Transmit Destination field in the game request drawer is required.

    a. For RAs when they place proxy requests.
    b. For Rights Holders when they place requests.

title: Request Drawer - Firefox - Issues with long drop-down options
custom_steps:
I logged into Batter-dev using Firefox while testing, because I needed to test different roles for a different story.  When I selected drop-downs in a game request drawer, and selected the longer options, the field resized to display the selected option fully, covering up the field names.  (SEE VIDEO)

I do not see the same issue in Chrome.

title: Client Broadcaster || Requests - Run and Display Rules Check Based on CB's Network Selection
custom_steps:
As a Rights Holder with multiple client mappings, I want to ensure that the violations and potential conflicts displayed in the game request drawer match the rights holder I placed the request for.


1. Test that violations and Potential Conflicts displayed match the contract violations of the Rights Holder the user selected.

     a. EX) Sammy has two client mappings, to SammyTV and MckervinFM. Sammy places a request for MckervinFM. Violations and Potential Conflicts displayed in the game request drawer match the violations generated by MckervinFM’s contract, not SammyTV’s. 

2. Display in Request Approver drawer.

3. Display in Rights Holder’s drawer.

custom_steps:

As Request Approver and Admin, I can cancel a request without issue.

     c. There is one line item for every denied game request.

4. Email does not display any backup game request information.

While testing another ticket, I noticed that the pop-up for a request's potential violation contains a mistake.  Can we change "provided" to "provide"?

title: Update "Request Status" Label in Game Request Drawer to Display Requesting Rights Holder Parent Company
custom_steps: “Request Status” label is replaced with the requesting Rights Holder’s parent broadcast company in all game request drawers.

title: CLONE - Request Approver || Game Requests Drawer - Implement Applicable Rules Check
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to implement the Applicable Rules check when a game is requested, so that I can catch any conflicts with a game request prior to approving it.


1. Applicable Rules check searches fields in the *Contract* section of the requesting broadcaster's profile for infractions, excluding the _Countries_ field.

2. Any possible conflicts populate in the _Potential Conflicts_ subsection of a Game Request Drawer, under *Applicable Rules*.
a. Returns:

     * Games per Week warning if the broadcaster has selected more games than allotted in the *Games per Week* field of the requesting broadcaster's profile. 
     * Games per Month warning if the broadcaster has selected more games than allotted in the *Games per Month* field of the requesting broadcaster's profile. 
     * Games per Season warning if the broadcaster has selected more games than allotted in the *Games per Season* field of the requesting broadcaster's profile.
     * The line of text in the *Special Rule* field, if present.

     1. Display one line of text for every *Special Rule* field present in the requesting broadcaster's profile.

     * Days with Restrictions warning if the broadcaster has selected a game for a restricted day, outlined in the _Regular Seasons Days of the Week Restrictions_ subsection of the requesting broadcaster's profile.

     1. Display a Fully Restricted warning if there is a day that has been checked for Fully Restricted.
     2. Display a Before time warning if the game request start time falls after the time specified in the *Before* field.
     3. Display an After time warning if the game request start time falls before the time specified in the *After* field.
     4. Display a Total Games warning if the requesting broadcaster has requested more than the number of games specified in the *# of Total Games* field.

     * Jewel Event warning if the requesting broadcaster has requested a Jewel Event not specified in the *Jewel Event Broadcast Rights* field of the broadcaster's profile. 

     * Any broadcasters found in the *Restricted Broadcaster* field as a list.

     1. NOTE: Broadcasters set here usually have competing contracts with the requesting broadcaster.
     2. If the only broadcaster in the *Restricted Broadcaster* section has *Non-Exclusivity* checked in their broadcaster profile, do not display an Applicable Rules error.
     3. NOTE: any broadcaster can broadcast games that a non-exclusive broadcaster has requested and been approved for.

title: Engineering Approver || Requests - Engineering Drawer Layout
custom_steps:
As an Engineering Approver, I want access to approved and denied game requests, so that I can easily interact with, sort through, and approve/deny the requests.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9


1. Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.

2. Clicking/tapping on a request with an _engineering_ status opens a screen which displays:
a. Game information at top of drawer. 
 * ORG @ ORG in Upper Left corner, pulled from *Event* column.
 * Information from *Day*, *Date*, and *Event* display.
        * Day is three letter abbreviation.
        * Date is mm/dd/yyyy 
        * Time is hh:mm AM/PM

 b. Requesting Broadcaster displays below event information in the Upper Left corner.
c. Game Request Status displays below event information in the Upper Right corner.
 * Status is _Engineering_ and is as displayed on the Zeplin (yellow/tannish).

 d. *Preferred Network*
 * This is the _Preferred Network_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

 e. *Notes*
 * This is the _Notes_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

 f. *Reason Taken*
 * This is the _Taken For_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

 g. *Admin Notes*
 * This is a freeform text field.

 h. *Backup*
 * Displays information of backup game selected in _Backup._
        * NOTE: this is the backup game in the original request's line item.
        * Status of backup denoted by colored circle.
              *This updates as backup game status is updated.
        * Time of game displays as hh:mm AM/PM ORG @ ORG.

 h. *Engineering Notes* (Text field
 
 i. *Transmission Method*
 * Defaults to the method selected in *Transmission Method* field of requesting broadcaster's Client Broadcaster profile.
 * Dropdown menu of all options listed in _Transmission Methods_ table.

 j. *Source Broadcast*
 * Required.
 * Defaults to the *Preferred Network* selected by the requesting broadcaster.
 * Dropdown menu of all options listed in the _Networks_ table (i.e. YES, SNY, etc.).

k. *Signage Path* 
 * Dropdown field of all options listed in Signage Path table.

 k. *Transmit*
 * Required.
 * Dropdown field of all options listed in the _Transmit_ table.

 l. *TX Format*
 * Dropdown field of all options listed in the _Transmit Formats_ table.

 m. *Destination*
 * Required.
 * Defaults to the value chosen by the requesting broadcaster.
 * Dropdown field of Destinations in requesting broadcaster's Client Broadcaster profile.

 n. *Notes*
 * Free response field.

 o. *Audio 1*
 * Field is free response.
 * Default value is value in *Audio 1* of requesting broadcaster's profile.

 p. *Audio 2*
 * Field is free response.
 * Default value is value in *Audio 2* of requesting broadcaster's profile.

 q. *Audio 3*
 * Field is free response.
 * Default value is value in *Audio 3* of requesting broadcaster's profile.

 r. *Audio 4*
 * Field is free response.
 * Default value is value in *Audio 4* of requesting broadcaster's profile.

 s. Trash icon displays to the right of each *Audio _* field.

 t. *add audio* button displays beneath all audio fields.

title: Engineering Approver || Requests - Mobile Filter Functionality
custom_steps:
As an Engineering Approver, I want to filter on the Requests table, so that I can find game requests more easily.


1. Search Bar displays at top of page.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.
2. *Status* dropdown displays beneath the search bar.
3. Date picker displays beneath the *Status* filter.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.

4.  *today* / *tomorrow* buttons not included on mobile.
5. *Include Backups* toggle not included on mobile.
6. Clicking on the filter *funnel* icon opens the filter drawer.
a. Filters display in the following order:
 * _Requester_
 * _Conflicts & No Conflicts_
 * *Reset Filters* button

7. Filter behavior is the same as desktop for all filters.

title: Request Approver || Game Request Summary Drawer - Display Conflicting Requests When Country with a Conflict is Clicked/Tapped
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to see the requests that have Country conflicts with the request I'm currently viewing. 

1. Upon click/tap of *Country* in _Potential Violations_ subsection of Game Request Summary Drawer, conflicting requests display in pop up.
a. NOTE: a conflicting request is a request to broadcast the same game in the same country by a different broadcaster.
b. This functionality only exists for game requests with Country violations.
2. Broadcaster, Country, and Status of conflicting game requests display in a table.
3. Table has one row for every conflicting game request.

Should look the same as the Possible Conflicts table below, but with Region renamed as Country.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14839563)

title: Request Approver || Game Request Summary Drawer - Display Explanation for Violating Requests
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to see user explanations for game requests that violate a user's contract, so that I can make a more informed decision when approving/denying the request.


1. *Explanation* field displays at bottom of Potential Violations section of Game Request Drawer.
a. Value is inputted text from *Explanation* field of Potential Violations pop up of the Broadcaster's request for this game.
b. Text in field can not be edited.

2. If text spans more than 5 lines, field has vertical scroll.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Build "Cancel" Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to be able to cancel a request, so that any extraneous requests can be cleaned up.



1. Only fully submitted game requests can be cancelled.
a. EX) Game request must display in the Request table to be able to be cancelled.

2. Clicking/tapping *Cancel* in a Game Request Summary drawer:
a. Opens a modal that asks the RA if they're sure they want to cancel.
 *  Clicking/tapping *Yes*:
      * Closes both the modal and the Game Request Summary drawer.
      * Removes the request from all Request tables. 
 * Clicking/tapping *No* loses the modal, bringing the RA back to the Game Request Summary drawer.

3. Cancelled requests are only displayed in:
a. The *All Requests* filtered view of the Requests table.
b. The *Cancelled* filtered view of the Requests table.

4. Game requests can be cancelled across all statuses.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Bulk Denial Reason Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to provide denial reasons when bulk denying game requests, so that the client broadcaster knows why their request was denied.

Zeplin (single deny request - excluding Bulk Backup denial functionality from MVP): https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/670e69829e6a492a28583fb8


1. When multiple requests are selected, clicking/tapping *Deny* displays a Denial Reason module.
a. Module displays game request details for every selected game.
*  *Requestor*
*  *Date*
*  *Event*
* Details only display for primary game request.
a. Beneath game request details, module displays freeform text field for denial reason. 

2. Clicking/tapping *Deny* on module triggers a Denial email send.
a. All broadcasters with denied game requests receive a denial email for their denied requests.
b. Email displays denial reason specific to each game request.
c. Game request status is updated to _Denied_.

3. Denied status update reflects across the Requests table of the following roles:
a. Admin
b. Request Approver
c. Engineering Approver
d. Broadcaster

4. Clicking/tapping *Deny* closes the module changes the selected game status' to _Denied._
5. Clicking/tapping *Cancel* closes the module and does NOT change the selected game status' to _Denied._
6. Clicking/tapping *X* closes the module and does NOT change the selected game status' to _Denied._

title: Request Approver || Requests - Denied Game Request Drawer  Layout
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want access to approved and denied game requests, so that I can easily interact with, sort through, and approve/deny the requests.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9 


1. Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.

2. Clicking/tapping on a denied request opens an approval screen which displays:
a. Game information at top of drawer.
*  ORG @ ORG in Upper Left corner.
     *  Pulled from *Event* column.
* Information from *Day*, *Date*, and *Event* display.
     * Day is three letter abbreviation.
     * Date is mm/dd/yyyy 
     * Time is hh:mm AM/PM.

  b. Requesting Broadcaster displays below event information in the Upper Left corner.

  c. Game Request Status displays below event information in the Upper Right corner.
* Status is _Denied_ and is red.

  d. *Preferred Network*
* This is the _Preferred Network_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

  e. *Notes*
* This is the _Notes_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

  f. *Reason Taken*
* This is the _Taken For_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

  g. *Admin Notes*
* This is a freeform text field.

  h. *Backup*
* Displays information of backup game selected in _Backup._
     * NOTE: this is the backup game in the original request's line item.
     * Status of backup denoted by colored circle.
          * This updates as backup game status is updated.
     * Time of game displays as hh:mm AM/PM ORG @ ORG.

3. *Denial Reason* displays below *Backup*.
* Displayed reason is the answer the Request Approver gave after clicking/tapping *Deny* in the Pending drawer.

4. "X" displays at Top Right of drawer.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Deny a Single Game Request
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to be able to deny a game request.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/670e69829e6a492a28583fb8


1. Clicking/tapping {{Deny}} on the game request summary drawer opens a _Deny Request_ module.
a. Displays:
* an "X" in the upper right corner.
      * Clicking/tapping "X" closes the window and returns the user to the game request summary drawer.
* a *Denial Reason* freeform field.
      * Required
* NOTE: We are not building Backup request denial into this module for MVP.

2. Clicking/tapping *Deny* in the module:
a. Changes the game request status to _Denied._
b. Sends a denial email to the requesting broadcaster.
c. Closes the module.
d. Displays deny message confirmation.

3. Clicking/tapping *Cancel*:
a. Closes the module
b. Does not save any any information inputted into the module.
c. Displays the game request summary drawer.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Desktop Layout
custom_steps:
As an Request Approver, I want to view approved and denied Network's game requests, so that I can see what requests have been made.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66d9f4f63158fab7123365c9 



1. Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.

2. Requests Table added.
a. Requestor
b. Day
c. Event 
d. Conflicts
e. Status
f. Backup
g. Conflicts
h. Backup Status

3. Left rail displays:
a. *Today* / *Tomorrow* filters
b. Date selector
c. Filters with counts displayed for:
* Pending
* Engineering
* Pre-Finalized
* All Open Requests

4. Top rail displays filters for:
a. If *Today* / *Tomorrow* has been selected from the left rail, team matchups for the selected day. (If not selected, matchup filter is hidden.)
b. All requestors.
c. Conflict/No Conflict.
d. Search bar.
e. *Include Backups* toggle.
f. *Reset Filters* button.

5. *Approve* button displays beneath top rail filters.

6. *Deny* button displays beneath top rail filters.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Display Applicable Rules Check in Game Request Approval Drawer
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to implement the Applicable Rules check when a game is requested, so that I can catch any conflicts with a game request prior to approving it.

_Zeplin:_ 

Violation Text Example: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9

Edit Client Broadcaster Profile: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66ede402483079d8c3530960 


1. Applicable Rules check runs upon submission of any game request.
2. Applicable Rules check searches fields in the *Contract* section of the requesting broadcaster's profile for infractions.
3. All violations display in *Potential Violations* field of Game Request Summary Drawer.
4. Display *pending counts include current request* at top right of violations table.

5. All violations are displayed in Game Request Summary Drawer.

a. Regular Season Days of the Week conflicts display when violations are found.

* https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2230 
* Display in the order: *Fully Restricted*, *Before*, *After*, then *# of Total Games*.
* *# of Total Games* displays pending and approved counts, including the current request in the counts.  (If no pending and/or approved requests exist, only display approved/pending counts, respectively.)

b. Country conflicts display when violations are found.

* https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2176 
* All countries where a conflict exist display.

c. Calculated General Restrictions values display when violations are found.

* https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2229 
* Display in the order: *Games per Week*, *Games per Month*, then *Games per Season*.  (If no pending and/or approved requests exist only display approved/pending counts, respectively.)
* Fields display pending and approved counts, including the current request in the counts.

d. Special Rules and Restricted Broadcasters are surfaced if present respective Client Broadcaster profile fields.

* https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2232 
* Display in the order: *Special Rule* then *Restricted Broadcaster*.
* Every *Special Rule* displays as its own row.

e. NOTE: Request Approvers will review the surfaced violations when deciding approvals.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Drawer Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to approve and deny game requests, so that I can easily interact with, sort through, and approve/deny the requests.

Zeplin Link: 

Approve Request: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66d9f4f63158fab7123365c9 



1. Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.

2. Clicking/tapping on a single requestor opens an request approval drawer.

3. Clicking/tapping *Approve* triggers:
a. Assigns the chosen game to the broadcaster who requested it.
* Backup Game can still be approved/denied.

    b. If there is backup game selected, the backup game's drawer will automatically open.
    c. Changes the request's status to *Pre-Finalized* or *Engineering* according to https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/STT-2177.

4. Clicking/tapping *Deny* triggers Denial Reason popup.
a. Clicking/tapping *Deny* does not assign the chosen game to the broadcaster who requested it and changes the request status to *Denied*. 
* Backup Game can still be approved/denied.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Enable Bulk Approve/Deny Button
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to be able to Approve/Deny game requests in bulk, so that I can cut down time spent on interacting with requests.


1. *Approve* / *Deny* buttons default disabled.

2. Clicking/tapping on the checkbox of one or more game requests enables the *Approve* / *Deny* buttons.

3. If any game with potential violations is selected, a warning is surfaced.
a. The warning is a pop-up.
b. The pop-up includes every game request with potential violations as a line item in a table.
c. A "+" displays to the left of the game request.
*  Clicking/tapping on the "+" displays all potential violations for the associated game request.
*  NOTE: Layout is the same as game request summary drawer.

    d. Checkbox displays to the left of the "+"
        * Clicking/tapping the checkbox selects/deselects the game request.

    e. Clicking/tapping *Approve* / *Deny* performs the intended action on ONLY the selected game requests.

4. Only game requests with a status of _Pending_ can be selected.
a. ex) Any game with a status of _Denied_ can not be bulk Approved.

5. When user clicks/taps on *Approve*:
a. All game requests with no potential violations will automatically change status from _Pending_ to _Engineering_.
* If _Pre-Finalized_ is checked in the requesting broadcaster's profile, their status is set directly to _Finalized_.

    b. Engineering status update reflects across the Requests table of the following roles:
        * Admin
        * Request Approver
        * Engineering Approver
        * Broadcaster

6. Only selected game requests will be eligible for a status change.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Finalized Drawer Layout
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want access to approved and denied game requests, so that I can easily interact with, sort through, and approve/deny the requests.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9 




Clicking/tapping on a finalized request opens a screen which displays:

1. Game information at top of drawer.
a. ORG @ ORG in Upper Left corner. (Pulled from *Event* column.)
b. Information from *Day*, *Date*, and *Event* display. (Day is three letter abbreviation, Date is mm/dd/yyyy, Time is hh:mm AM/PM.)

2. Requesting Broadcaster displays below event information in the Upper Left corner.

3. Game Request Status displays below event information in the Upper Right corner
a. Status is _Finalized_ and is green.

4. *Preferred Network*
a. This is the _Preferred Network_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

5. *Notes*
a. This is the _Notes_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

6. *Reason Taken*
a. This is the _Taken For_ the Broadcaster has inputted in their Game Request drawer.

7. *Admin Notes*
a. This is a freeform text field.

8. *Backup*
a. Displays information of backup game selected in _Backup._ 
b. NOTE: this is the backup game in the original request's line item.
c. Status of backup denoted by colored circle.
* This updates as backup game status is updated.
d. Time of game displays as hh:mm AM/PM ORG @ ORG.

9. *Transmission Method*
a.  The method displayed is the method the Engineering Approver has inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

10. *Source Broadcast*
a. Required.
b. The Source Broadcast displayed is the Source Broadcast the Engineering Approver has inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

11. *Transmit*
a. Required.
b. The transmit data displayed is the transmit data the Engineering Approver has previously inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

12. *TX Format*
a. The TX format displayed is the transmit data the Engineering Approver has previously inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

13. *Destination*
a. Required.

14. *Notes*
a. The notes displayed are the notes the Engineering Approver has previously inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

15. *Audio 1-4*
a. The audio displayed is the audio the Engineering Approver has previously inputted in the corresponding field of the Engineering Approver drawer.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Implement Game Request Status Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to assign accurate statuses to game requests, so that broadcasters can stay apprised of and take necessary steps to finalize their game requests.


1. Upon submission of a game request, game request status is automatically _Pending_.
a. If a broadcaster's profile has _Allow Auto-Approval_ checked, then their status can be set to _Engineering_, regardless if all necessary engineering information is present.
* NOTE: Skips _Pending_status. Allow Auto-Approval skips approval from Request Approvers and goes straight to Engineering Approver.}



2. When a user clicks/taps Approve*:
a. Game request status is set to _Engineering_ if at least one of *Source Broadcast*, *Transmit*, and/or *Destination* is missing.
* Required engineering information includes *Source Broadcast*, *Transmit*, and *Destination*.



3. When a game request is approved after being in the -_Pre-Finalized_- -or- _Engineering_ status stage, its status becomes _Finalized_.
4. When a user clicks/taps *Deny* in a game request drawer, the game's status is set to _Denied_.
5. Whenever a status is updated, the new status and associated color icon is reflected across all *Status* columns of any Request or Summary Table and Game Request Summary Drawers.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Mobile Filter Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to filter on the Requests table, so that I can find game requests more easily.


1. Search Bar displays at top of page.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.

2. *Status* dropdown displays beneath the search bar.
3. Date picker displays beneath the *Status* filter.
a. NOTE: location will ultimately be based on where it fits best.

4. *today* / *tomorrow* buttons not included on mobile.

5. *Include Backups}} toggle not included on mobile.

6. Clicking on the filter "funnel" icon opens the filter drawer.
a. Filters display in the following order:
*  _Requester_
*  _Conflicts & No Conflicts_
* *Reset Filters* button

7. Filter behavior is the same as desktop for all filters.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Mobile Layout
custom_steps:
As an Request Approver, I want to view approved and denied Network's game requests, so that I can see what requests have been made.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Pending Game Request Drawer  Layout
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want access to approved and denied game requests, so that I can easily interact with, sort through, and approve/deny the requests.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Requests Table Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to interact with the Request table, so that I can easily sort through, view, and approve/deny the requests.

Zeplin Link:

Implement Desktop and Mobile mockups.
Requests Page: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66d9f4f63158fab7123365c9 
Today/Tomorrow Filter: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1c2dbf975d33c78109af3 

---

1. Filters display information in the Requests table that match the selected values.
* Types of requesters defaults *All Requesters*.
        * Counts displayed in left rail filters update to match the count of filtered table results.

    * Conflict/No Conflict defaults *Conflicts & No Conflicts*. 
        * Other filter values are *Conflict* and *No Conflict*.
        * Counts displayed in left rail filters update to match the count of filtered table results.

    * Left Rail defaults *Pending*.
        * Clicking/tapping on _Engineering, Pre-finalized, All Open Requests,_ and _All Requests_ filters the table by the chosen value.
        * Counts displayed in left rail filters do not update to match filtered table results when left rail filter is clicked/tapped.
            * ex) Clicking/tapping _Pending_ will not make counts of other left rail filters 0.
        * Counts of left rail filters count Primary and Backup requests as separate entities.

    * *Include Backups* defaults *On*.
        * Switching on/off displays/hides the Backup, [Backup] Conflicts, and Backup Status columns.
        * This updates the left rail filter to include/exclude backup games in total counts when the toggle is on/off.
        * If *Include Backups* is switched off, the table size stays the same.

    * *Today* / *Tomorrow* defaults disabled.
        * Clicking/tapping *Today* / *Tomorrow* filters triggers a game filter to display above top rail filters.
        * When *Today* is clicked/tapped, Games displayed must be for the current date. 
            * *Today* is highlighted.
            * Updates *Date* filter to current date.
        * When {{Tomorrow}} is clicked/tapped, Games displayed must be for the current date + 1.
            * *Tomorrow* is highlighted.
            * Updates *Date* filter to current date + 1.
        * If *Today* / *Tomorrow* filter is enabled, clicking it again will deselect it.
        * *Today* and *Tomorrow* can't be selected at the same time.

    * *Date* defaults empty (i.e. reflects all requests).
        * Clicking/Tapping the *Date* selector opens a calendar flyout.
        * Format mm/dd/yyyy.
        * Accepts only numbers and backlash.
        * Accepts only valid dates.
        * Displays date of *Today* / *Tomorrow* filter when selected.
        * Entering a date clears the *Today* / *Tomorrow* filter, returning results from the entered date.
            * *Today* / *Tomorrow* filter un-highlights.

    * *Search* defaults empty.
        * Accepts freeform text.
        * Surfaces line items with matching keywords.
            * Line items span both Primary and Backup requests made.
            * Whole line item is surfaced.
        * Does not reset any top or left rail filter that has a non-default value selected.
        * Results match line items in *Requestor*, *Event*, and *Backup* columns.

    * *Reset Filters* button:
        * Clicking this returns all filters to aforementioned defaults.

    * Clicking/tapping a column header sorts the table by that column.
        * Clicking/tapping the column again will sort the Requests table the opposite way.
        * Defaults Ascending.

---

* *Approve* / *Deny* remain disabled until one or more rows are checked off.
* Filtering table surfaces entire line item, even if only Primary or Backup Request matches search results.
* Table has vertical scroll.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Requests Table Population
custom_steps:
As an Request Approver, I want access to real-time information on game requests, so that I can make informed decisions when approving/denying requests.

Zeplin Link: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66d9f4f63158fab7123365c9 



1.Requests table is updated in real-time with newly inputted requests.
a. Counts of left rail filters will update to reflect this request.

2. *Requestor* displays the Broadcaster's Name.
3. *Day* displays the Event's 3-letter abbreviated day.
4. *Event* column displays primary game request's Day/Time and Teams information.
5. *Conflicts* is the count of other broadcast requests from the same country for the same game.
a. The displayed count matches the number of conflicts found during the Possible Conflicts check.
b. The count will increase/decrease as game requests are submitted/denied.

6. *Status* column displays status of Event game request.
a. Displayed status matches phase of approval process Primary game request falls in.
b. Column updates in real-time as requests are approved/denied/updated.

7. *Backup* column displays Backup game request's Day/Time and Teams information.
a. Data only populates if Backup game has been requested.

8. *Backup Status* column displays status of Backup game request.
a. Data only populates if Backup game has been requested.
b. Displayed Backup status matches phase of approval process game request falls in.
c. Column updates in real-time as requests are approved/denied/updated.

title: Request Approver || Game Request Summary Drawer - Display Country Conflicts in Drawer
custom_steps:
As a request approver, I want the country conflicts table to display in the Game Request Drawer, so that the violations are more prominent when making an approval decision.

_Zeplin:_ https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9

1. Country Conflicts display in Game Request Summary Drawer, rather than via pop out. 
2. Conflicts table displays above Applicable Rules check section.
3. Table only includes the following columns:

     a. Client Broadcaster
     b. Event
     c. Status
4. Conflicts table displays information for all countries with conflicts.

title: Request Approver || Requests - Bulk Denial Reason Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to provide denial reasons when bulk denying game requests, so that the client broadcaster knows why their request was denied.

Zeplin (single deny request - excluding Bulk Backup denial functionality from MVP): https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/670e69829e6a492a28583fb8

1. When multiple requests are selected, clicking/tapping Deny displays a Denial Reason module.

     a. Module displays game request details for every selected game.
         i. Requestor
         ii. Date
         iii. Event
         iv. Details only display for primary game request.
     b. Beneath game request details, module displays freeform text field for denial reason. 

2. Clicking/tapping Deny on module triggers a Denial email send.

     a. All broadcasters with denied game requests receive a denial email for their denied requests.
     b. Email displays denial reason specific to each game request.
     c. Game request status is updated to Denied.

3. Denied status update reflects across the Requests table of the following roles:

     a. Admin
     b. Request Approver
     c. Engineering Approver
     d. Broadcaster
4. Clicking/tapping Deny closes the module changes the selected game status' to Denied.
5. Clicking/tapping Cancel closes the module and does NOT change the selected game status' to Denied.
6. Clicking/tapping X closes the module and does NOT change the selected game status' to Denied.

title: Requesting Approver || Game Request Summary Drawer - Send Approval Summary Emails
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to send broadcasters an email of their approved game request details, so that they have access to necessary game information.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66e1afcb59bab37c41b496e9


1. Upon click/tap of Approve in the submitted Request Approver drawer view...
     a. Email is sent to requesting broadcaster of approved game’s details.
     b. Email template matches attached template, with logos added.

2. Only the accountholder’s email will receive the email.
     a. Should it be everyone associated with the broadcast?

3. Transmit Start is replaced by “First Pitch”.
4. Transmit End is removed. 
5. Information found in email template is pulled directly from the information in the approved game request.

     a. Broadcaster is the requesting broadcaster.
     b. Date matches Date.
     c. First Pitch matches First Pitch time.
     d. Game Time matches the timestamp in Event.
     e. Game matches ORG @ ORG in Event.
                i. Includes logos.

title: Engineering Approver || Game Request Summary Drawer - Send Transmission Summary Emails
custom_steps:
As an Engineering Approver, I want to send broadcasters an email of their finalized transmission details, so that they have access to necessary transmission information.


1. Upon click/tap of Finalize…

     a. Email is sent to requesting broadcaster of finalized transmission details.
     b. Email template matches attached template.

2. Only the accountholder’s email will receive the email.

     a. Should it be everyone associated with the broadcast?
3. Transmit Start is replaced by “First Pitch”.

4. Transmit End is removed. 

5. Information found in email template is pulled directly from the information in finalized the game request.

     a. Broadcaster is the requesting broadcaster.
     b. Date matches Date.
     c. First Pitch matches First Pitch time.
     d. Game Time matches the timestamp in Event.
     e. Game matches ORG @ ORG in Event.
         i. Includes logos.
     f. Source Broadcast matches Preferred Network.
     g. Transmit matches Transmit.
     h. Destination matches Destination.
         i. Audios 1-4 match Audios 1-4.



![](index.php?/attachments/get/14888425)

title: Request Approver || Jewel Events - Display Signage Field in Request Summary Drawer
custom_steps:
As a member of MLBi, I want to assign a signage route to Broadcasters, so that we can display appropriate behind home plate signage.


1. Signage field only displays in Request summary drawers if the game requested is/belongs to…

    a. All-Star Game.
    b. World Series.
    c. League Championship Series.
         i. AL
         ii. NL
2. If requesting broadcaster is assigned a Country in their profile that is/is apart of the following list, each matching associated signage route displays in the Signage dropdown of the game request drawer.

     EX) If a client broadcaster has France in the Country field of their profile, display ASG - Europe in their Signage dropdown.
     EX) If a client broadcaster has both France and Japan in the Country field of their profile, display ASG - Europe AND ASG - Japan in their Signage dropdown.

3. If a requesting broadcaster does not have a Country belonging to or matching any of the above in their profile, only the World signage option displays in their Preferred Network dropdown.

title: Request Approver || Proxy Requests - Display Create Request Module Mobile
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to choose which game and broadcaster I am making a request on behalf of, so that the request can be accurately assigned to them.

_Zeplin:_ 

Module: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67e5b98b6ef36d2b86212d1f
Mobile Drawer: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66f417efe0894e4c92466df6 

1. Create Request module opens as a drawer on mobile.

2. “Create Request” displays as drawer header.

3. Broadcaster dropdown filter displays with label “Select broadcaster”.

4. Date picker filter displays.

5. Both filters are single select.

6. Continue button displays in bottom right corner of module.

7. Cancel button displays in bottom right corner of module to left of Continue button.

8. Game tiles…

     a. Display match up as ORG @ ORG.

     b. Display game time as HH:MM AM/PM ET beneath match up information.

     c. All text is centered.

title: Request Approver || Proxy Requests - Create Request Module Functionality Mobile
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want to be able to decide who Iâ€™m making a request for and for which game.

_Zeplin:_ https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67e5b98b6ef36d2b86212d1f



1. Clicking/tapping the Broadcaster dropdown displays all elements in the Client Broadcaster Settings page.

2. Clicking/tapping the date filter displays a date picker. 

3. Selecting a date displays game tiles for all games scheduled for that day.

     a. Games will update in real-time.

4. Game tiles subsection has vertical scroll if more than three lines of elements are needed.

5. Clicking/tapping Continue opens up a Game Request drawer from the Rights Holder’s view.

     a. Within the Game Request Drawer all fields default empty, except for Taken for, which defaults “Live”.

     b. The header for the drawer displays as the game chosen in the Create Request module.

     c. The subheader for the drawer displays as the Rights Holder selected in the Broadcaster field.

6. Clicking/tapping Cancel closes the window and does not save any inputted information.

title: Request Approver || Proxy Requests - Save Inputted Information to Correct Rights Holder Requests Table
custom_steps:
As a Request Approver, I want the information Rights Holder to be able to track requests I make on their behalf.
As a Rights Holder, I want to track requests Request Approvers make on my behalf, so I know not to make redundant requests. 

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/67e5b98b6ef36d2b86212d1f


1. Request made on behalf of Rights Holder displays on the following pages of the associated Rights Holder’s BATTER UI:
a. Request table
b. Calendar
c. Calendar Summary table

2. Request line items display accurate information for the following columns for the request made by the Rights holder:
a. Date
b. Event
c. Conflict
d. Status
e. Backup
f. Backup Conflicts
g. Backup Status

3. Request displays with accurate color (designating Status) in the Calendar view.

4. Status of game request created is automatically Engineering. 

5. Engineering Approvers can interact with the game request as needed.
